txt.en: 'Igerna? Aye, she came through here, but she's gone on up north.'

'[placeholder]! You return without Igerna, I see.'

You hand him the pack, and a worried recognition passes across his face.

'This is a troublesome outcome indeed. Why would Igerna leave her pack behind? The leather is shredded, but thankfully there is no blood to be found. Perhaps she made an escape!'
Húrwen spoke with Igerna, who continued on towards the mountains in search of more goblins.\n\nYou should look for signs of Igerna in northern Pinnath Gelin.

'Well met. I am Lúmar, scout commander for the Knights of the Green Hills. And you - well, your reputation precedes you. The knights have spoken your name with cheer around many a fire. I pray I can charge you with a small task. My fellow scout, Igerna, went north to look into troubling reports of goblin activity. Alas, she missed her deadline for reporting back, and I can wait no longer before pressing on to Ost Arndír.\n\n'Will you follow in her footsteps and see if she requires aid? She's one of the most capable scouts we have, and it's unlike h�
